title: U.S. college students average study hours , by major 2011
yAxis: Number of hours spent studying per week
summary: This bar chart has 29 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Number of hours spent studying per week in each Month on the y axis.
The Number of hours spent studying per week is highest at Month Architecture and lowest at Month Speech.
The highest Month Architecture has 12.9 more Number of hours spent studying per week than the lowest Month Speech.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Number of hours spent studying per week in the y axis.
The Number of hours spent studying per week is appeared to be the highest at Month Architecture and lowest at Month Speech.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 29 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Number of hours spent studying per week in each Month on the y axis.
The Number of hours spent studying per week is highest at Month Architecture and lowest at Month Speech.
The highest Month Architecture has 12.9 more Number of hours spent studying per week than the lowest Month Speech.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Number of hours spent studying per week in the y axis.
The Number of hours spent studying per week is highest at Month Architecture and lowest at Month Speech.
The highest value at Month Architecture is 2.19x times more than the lowest value at Speech.
Number of hours spent studying per week at Month Architecture is 23.7 , second place is  at 23.7, and thirdly is Physics at 19.7.
Overall Number of hours spent studying per week has reduced over the Months.
Month Theater, and Anthropology share the same value 16.0.
The highest value 23.7 at Architecture is almost 1.53 times larger than the average value 15.47.
The Number of hours spent studying per week is 448.5 if we add up values of all Months.
